text-unit.text: Figure 1:An example imageIn the quaint village of Green-wood, nestled at the edge of a whis-pering forest, a unique tradition hasbeen thriving for centuries. Everyspring, the villagers gather to cele-brate the Festival of Blooms, a vi-brant event marked by an explosion ofcolors and scents. The festival centersaround the competition of floral ar-rangements, where participants fromall age groups display their creativitywith flowers handpicked from the surrounding woods. The air is filled with thesweet fragrance of wild roses, lilacs, and jasmine, mingling with the sound oflaughter and folk music. Children dart between stalls, their faces painted withpetal motifs, while elders share stories of festivals past. The highlight of theevent is the crowning of the Bloom Queen, a title bestowed upon the creatorof the most breathtaking floral display. This tradition, more than just a cel-ebration, is a testament to the villageâ€™s deep connection with nature and itscycles
